meanings.definition: To have a stronger or more pleasant smell than someone or something else.
meanings.sent1: The flowers in the garden outsmelled the ones in the vase.
meanings.sent2: The fresh bread outsmelled the burnt toast in the kitchen.
meanings.sent3: The delicious aroma of the cookies outsmelled the stinky cheese.
meanings.sent4: The scent of the ocean outsmelled the pollution in the city.
meanings.sent5: The fragrant perfume outsmelled the musty old books.

meanings.definition: To detect a smell with the sense of smell.
meanings.sent1: She outsmelled the smoke from the barbecue down the street.
meanings.sent2: The dog outsmelled the hidden treat in the room.
meanings.sent3: He outsmelled the fresh pie cooling on the windowsill.
meanings.sent4: The detective outsmelled the faint scent of the suspect in the crowd.
meanings.sent5: The chef outsmelled the spices in the dish to create a perfect blend.
